item.title: Anarcho-Syndicalism
item.description: Noam Chomsky Anarcho-: Decentralization of power Syndicalism: Worker’s union’s ownership of Means of Production A realistic alternative to Marxism .

item.title: Annuity
item.description: Annuities are… Money you borrowed: mortgages, etc. ⇒ pay regularly to pay off large amount Money you lent: social security credit, etc. ⇒ give large money, get regular payments later Amortization is the same thing but from a different perspective ⇒ You’re spreading a one-time cost into multiple years.

item.title: Apple's Philosophy
item.description: The Cook Doctrine We believe that we are on the face of the earth to make great products and that’s not changing. We are constantly focusing on innovating.

item.title: Applications of Discrete Markov Chains
item.description: Gamber’s Ruin § game. Gambler’s Ruin. Gambler starts out with i units. They have probability p of earning one unit, 1−p losing one unit, iid per round.

item.title: Approximating Distributions
item.description: thm. A Normal Distribution with μ=np,σ=np(1−p)​ will approximate a Binomial distribution with n trials and success probability p when np>1 P(a≤X≤b)=k=a∑b​P(X=k)≃∫ab​fnormal​(μ=np,σ=np(1−p)​)dx REMARK.

item.title: Approximation Algorithm
item.description: def. Approximation Factor. α(n)-level approximation. For optimization problem π, ALG is a α-level optimization algorithm iff for input I of size n: max[OPT(I)ALG(I)​,ALG(I)OPT(I)​]=α(n) Smaller is better! Constant approximation factor: if approximation factor doesn’t depend on n, ALG is a constant α-level approximation .
